text:
JENNIFER "PENNY" MARTINAND:
You know, we were young.
We were still in college.

LISA LEVINE: The issue of
the day for me was definitely
pro-choice rights for women.

Looking at these photos
helps me remember.

JENNIFER "PENNY" MARTINAND:
My name is Jennifer Martinand.
My friends call me Penny.
I live in the Chicago suburbs.
LISA LEVINE: I am Lisa Levine.
I live in New York City.

JESSICA SISTO:
I'm Jessica Sisto.

I live in San
Francisco, California.

JENNIFER "PENNY"
MARTINAND: When I

was in college, Jessica, Lisa
and I, we went to the march

It was organized by
Planned Parenthood.

JESSICA SISTO: The '92 march
was a pro choice march.

So it was very specifically
for a Supreme Court case that

was being tried at the time.
For

LISA LEVINE: For me,
it was an adventure,
and certainly a social event.

But also an important
expression of our strong views.

JENNIFER "PENNY" MARTINAND:
You know we were young,
we were still in college.

JESSICA SISTO: We had
a party at our house.

The bus from New
Jersey from Rutgers

going to DC after like
4:00 in the morning.

So we were like, oh, we'll
just stay up all night.
And have a party.

Because that's what
you do when you're 22.

JENNIFER "PENNY"
MARTINAND: I was just

overwhelmed by the
signs and the people

and just the feeling of love
and doing something important.

LISA LEVINE: As I
look at these photos,

I didn't realize at the time,
and you don't really know when
something will be historic.

And that's why I
want to go again.

JENNIFER "PENNY"
MARTINAND: I think

it's sad that we have to go
back again after 25 years
to do the same fight.

LISA LEVINE: I think that this
election campaign season taught

us that really not
much has changed

in terms of how we,
as a society, look at
and what we expect from women.

JESSICA SISTO: The fact
that a lot of things

haven't progressed
in a positive way

makes it really
important to go again.
